message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CL

The paper proposes a method for multi-task learning in deep neural networks, specifically for scenarios where a large number of tasks need to be performed by a single model. This suggests that the paper could belong to several sub-categories related to machine learning and computer vision, such as cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper introduces a new layer called the Task Routing Layer (TRL), which could be relevant to sub-categories related to neural networks and deep learning, such as cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper evaluates its method on several datasets, which could make it relevant to sub-categories related to natural language processing and text classification, such as cs.CL (Computation and Language).
